result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation apply to both counts.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul L Peterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Paul L Peterson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 3 & 4.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 3 & 4. Court dismisses Ct. 1 & 2 but read in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay the DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Paul L Peterson in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand

Defendant Paul L Peterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Paul L Peterson in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
